Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Entourage \En`tou`rage"\ ([aum]N`t[=oo]`r[.a]zh"), n. [F.] Surroundings; specif., collectively, one's attendants or associates.
The entourage and mode of life of the mikados were not such as to make of them able rulers. --B. H. Chamberlain. [Webster 1913 Suppl.] ||
entourage n : the group following and attending to some important person [syn: {cortege}, {retinue}, {suite}]
